intro: Chaetaria gossypina, commonly known as the cottonleaf or cottonbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
